availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles D. Bradbury (Mason County, Kentucky, day laborer)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, day laborer. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Jolly Haley Bradbury in Harrison County, Kentucky, in August 1842. Stepfather of Ann Haley Bradbury. Father of Margaret J. Bradbury, Martha W. Bradbury, Harriet B. Bradbury, Mary E. Bradbury, Susan F. Bradbury, Amanda E. Bradbury, and Emma W. Bradbury. Day laborer in Mason County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 252.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Bermantown, p. 314A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, 1831-1867, Film #000216896, p. 352.
